storyInfo: During the war, soldiers fought side-by-side and sang songs together, as they marched towards victory. Today, however, things are not as they have hoped, and Vina is not happy with what she has been able to achieve for the city.

attributes.content: ...Lieutenant...
Lieutenant... Shearer... wake... up...
He sees a pair of hands reach out towards him.
...Lady Delphine?
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Don't move. I'll carry you. We need to get back to the forward position that we captured.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: We have to move before more Sarkaz arrive and fill this place with witchcraft bombs.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I—thank you—saving my life—
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: No need. It was a brave soldier and nurse, Sarah, who saved your life.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: She used her Arts to protect you and the other wounded soldiers from the witchcraft bomb, despite her limited experience.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: It was her... wait, did she—
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Don't worry, she just passed out. We've taken her to the forward position at the access port.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: But you've all been exposed to high-Originium environments for too long...
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I knew the risks.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: You succeeded in reaching the access port?
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I saw fire on the wall... it's out.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Is the battle for the walls over?
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: No, it has only just begun.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: The Nachzehrer is locked in a standoff with the ducal alliance, relying on the city's defensive artillery and the elite troops.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Is there anything we can do?
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Break through the access port, create a gap in the wall, and reveal a weakness in the Sarkaz lines.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Just like the alliance helped us... even if they didn't mean to.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Understood—*cough*—
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Lieutenant Shearer, you are dismissed from this operation. That is an order.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Does that come from Siege—
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: It comes from me.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Stand by at the forward position. You need to rest.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: <p=1>Exemplars Forward Position, City Wall Access Port</><p=2>September 25th, 1098, 8:21 A.M.</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.content: ♪Then may we call and savely syng,
attributes.name: Cheerful Soldier

attributes.content: May the vast lands they keep owre kynge. ♪
attributes.name: Excitable Soldier

attributes.content: ......His people, and alle his well-wyllynge. ♪
attributes.name: Composed Soldier

attributes.content: And give them grace wythoute endyng. ♪
attributes.name: Cheerful Soldier

attributes.content: Why aren't you singing?
attributes.name: Cheerful Soldier

attributes.content: Cheer up, man! I know, we're all hurt, but we're almost home!
attributes.name: Cheerful Soldier

attributes.content: ♪Then may we call and savely syng,
attributes.name: Cheerful Soldier

attributes.content: ♪Victoria, yeve thankes for owre hom!
attributes.name: Excitable Soldier

attributes.content: V—Victoria, yeve thankes for owre hom! ♪
attributes.name: Depressed Soldier

attributes.content: Here, you can have the rest of this ration. Couldn't finish it.
attributes.name: Cheerful Soldier

attributes.content: It's our first breakfast since we came back home. Got to fill up!
attributes.name: Cheerful Soldier

attributes.content: Once the rest of our men make it into the city, we'll show those devils who really runs Londinium!
attributes.name: Excitable Soldier
Morgan
attributes.content: I don't like that song...

attributes.name: Morgan
attributes.content: What about you, Vina?
Don't ask her. She hums it in her sleep.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Hannah!
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Shut your gob and eat up, Indra.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Or I'll take it, if you don't want it, and I'll lead the assault since you got hurt attacking the Confessarius passage.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Not a chance. It's just a scratch.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: A little scratch won't dull my fists. You're not gettin' ahead of me this time, Dagda.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Hmph.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: I'll do another round of patrol and scout ahead once I'm done, make sure there's no mistake.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: The Military Commission set up defenses at this backup access port, which should only have been known to the workers who built the wall. This means they know the city much better than we expected.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I'm back from patrol, Lady Delphine.
Spare a ration? I haven't had breakfast yet.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Lieutenant?! I thought you were recovering from your injuries.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: I'm a medic. I know how to restore a soldier to combat effectiveness as quickly as possible.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: I understand my own body, Lady Delphine. I am ready to return to duty.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Giving your protective equipment to the wounded, getting exposed to high-Originium environments, and being in close proximity to a witchcraft bomb explosion... you know exactly what all this means, Lieutenant.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I do. A blood test is not possible now, but I understand the pathological progress of infection.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: What about it? Is that not normal in this place?
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: He looks around. Exemplars are crowded around the narrow passage.
The dust and Originium particles that cover their faces have not diminished the fire in their eyes at all.
They know what they are doing. They know the price they will pay.
But they are singing.
Delphine, do you give the Lieutenant permission to return to duty?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Delphine can see the painkiller injector that Shearer is trying to hide behind his back.
Without sufficient access to Oripathy suppressants, painkillers are the next best thing to deal with the suffering brought on by Oripathy.
Will you pull through?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Of course, Lady Delphine. Never forget, I still have to see you go home and take back what is yours.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: ...You didn't need to do this.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Neither did you.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: You want to witness what this ragtag team can achieve, what will come of this city. So do I.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Very well, Lieutenant. Back to your post.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: What will Londinium be, once we drive out the devils, Vina?
attributes.name: Cheerful Soldier

attributes.content: Better than before, at least.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: You know what I'd like to see? More flower shops, making the flowers cheaper, making it easier for me to find a girl to marry. Maybe a wealthy young woman. Or a widow who lost her husband.
attributes.name: Cheerful Soldier

attributes.content: I want more Originium fuel for a warmer winter.
attributes.name: Excitable Soldier

attributes.content: ...I want more police stations, and I wanna become a cop. I want to give, not take.
attributes.name: Composed Soldier

attributes.content: What about you?
attributes.name: Cheerful Soldier

attributes.content: I... I hope Mum's still waiting for me back home.
attributes.name: Depressed Soldier

attributes.content: Hah, don't worry! She'll be there to open the door for you.
attributes.name: Cheerful Soldier

attributes.content: What about you, Dagda? You gonna stick with us to get the gym back in business, or will you lock yourself away in your tower?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: You and I, we've got a score to settle, Hannah.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Let's go back to the gym together, Vina!
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Yes, we will... we haven't found Baird yet...
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.text: One more step until we're home. That one step took us three days.
\nWe were welcomed by steam gushing from the factories, reaching into the clouds.
But many didn't live to see it. They walked into the tunnel, singing, and never came out again.

attributes.content: <p=1>Ten Pints Pub</><p=2>December 21st, 1098, 5:25 P.M.</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.content: Have one on me, Vina!
attributes.name: Excited Soldier

attributes.content: The devils ran, but they're not dead yet! They still have that tech that filled the city with Originium dust. They'll be back, mark my words!
attributes.name: Excited Soldier

attributes.content: And you can bet those dukes won't give a shit about us when something happens again.
attributes.name: Impetuous Soldier

attributes.content: Like you said, we need to defend ourselves.
attributes.name: Impetuous Soldier

attributes.content: That's why I don't believe the rumors that say the Exemplars are getting disbanded. Right, Vina?
attributes.name: Impetuous Soldier

attributes.content: Do you remember the wishes we made at the access port?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: For the factory boilers to burn bright as they used to, for the guns on Londinium's walls to defend her as they used to.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: For the doors of the police stations to be wide open to all, for the police to defy the nobles' will and treat the Infected with fairness and justice.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: For the law of Parliament to be the only rule... that's what I hope to see, and what I'm trying to bring about.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Are you happy with Londinium now? Has she gotten better?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I can tell you that I'm not happy.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: You're dodging the question, Madam Speaker.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: If you choose to do nothing and keep the status quo of the Exemplars, that's entirely fine with everyone.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: All they want is an answer. Will the Exemplars continue to exist—
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: This is my answer, Lieutenant.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: What Parliament fears is your trust in me, personally, that runs deeper than your trust in Parliament itself.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Perhaps they fear that the Exemplars will become the private army of Vina Victoria.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: What will become of the glory and honor of the Exemplars when that day comes?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Will the day come when our wishes come true?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Thank you. I will inform Parliament of what I learned today. It's not my place to give an answer over the heads of Parliament.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Let's go, Morgan.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Morgan?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: You go first, Vina. I'll have a couple of rounds with the guys here.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: ...Sure.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.text: I didn't understand what Vina said that day.
\nBut I agreed with the Lieutenant. Our Exemplar comrades needed our help. That's why I needed to stay, stay on Vina's behalf, at least talk to them.
\nEven though she was the Speaker, and there was so much she could do...
For the first time since the war ended, I drank until I passed out. It burned my belly.
\nIt was Hannah who found me, and I asked her the question that I could never ask Vina—
When can we go home, back to our gym?

attributes.content: The herbs are growing well. Diane would be glad.
attributes.name: Sanatorium Patient

attributes.content: When the farm was rebuilt, it was she who persuaded the engineers to leave behind the damaged lighting equipment and refit it for small greenhouses that didn't draw so much power.
attributes.name: Sanatorium Patient

attributes.content: Sorry... remind me, where were we?
attributes.name: Sanatorium Patient

attributes.content: We were talking about your condition.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: You mentioned that you noticed a significant increase in the strength of your Originium Arts.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Yes. Sorry, I'm finding it hard to remember things lately. Keep getting distracted. The doctor says Originium has made its way into my brain...
attributes.name: Sanatorium Patient

attributes.content: Don't tell me, I've told you this before too?
attributes.name: Sanatorium Patient

attributes.content: We're just chatting. You can say anything you want. Anything else that doesn't feel right?
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Difficulty walking straight? It's happening to a lot of people, though.
attributes.name: Sanatorium Patient

attributes.content: Ataxia. It's a common symptom of many Infected in Londinium, but I'm not sure what the cause is.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: When I'm by myself, I've been trying to... it's strange. My Originium Arts seem to be changing.
attributes.name: Sanatorium Patient

attributes.content: Changing? I don't have any other reports of—
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Never mind. Please continue, Sarah.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Are you casting with your bare hands, by the way? The doctors may have told you this already, but that's detrimental to keeping your condition under control.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Heh. You're a worrier alright, just like Diane said.
attributes.name: Sanatorium Patient

attributes.content: I just can't help it. It's how I search for the war memories in my clouded mind.
attributes.name: Sanatorium Patient

attributes.content: The battle for the walls.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: You said you were a nurse, and you were trying to stop a witchcraft bomb explosion with your Arts, but it didn't work out too well.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Yes. I remember I was behind Lieutenant Shearer, and the blast threw me off my feet.
attributes.name: Sanatorium Patient

attributes.content: Next thing I remember, I was in the field hospital, lying next to the other acute Infected.
attributes.name: Sanatorium Patient

attributes.content: I don't know how many witchcraft bombs fell upon the Exemplars.
attributes.name: Sanatorium Patient

attributes.content: So many fates, turned on their heads in an instant... but I didn't see any of it, and I don't remember any of it... how could things be like this?
attributes.name: Sanatorium Patient

attributes.content: Sarah?
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: The patient is trembling, and begins to cast Originium Arts without realizing it.
Eliseo does not know if it is a symptom of post-traumatic stress, but he quickly attempts to direct her attention elsewhere.
Listen to me, Sarah. Take a deep breath.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Can you smell the flowers? You're in the sanatorium.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: The war is over. The Exemplars are home. You're back in Londinium.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: You're...
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: He pauses and looks up at the damaged lighting above his head.
A strange and unfamiliar city, one that, to his eyes, is not far off from a pile of rubble.
'You're in... a place where everything will get better.'
The alteration of Sarah's Originium Arts is a symptom that has never been observed in other Infected. I should ask my colleagues to keep an eye out.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: I wonder if Diane could get me in touch with an international Messenger. Waiting for Maylander's regular Messenger would take too long. Londinium needs supplies, urgently...
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: ...Huh?
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Eliseo! You're here too?
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: —Why didn't you stop her? Weren't you looking for her?
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: Who?
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: The Speaker.
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: The Speaker?! I saw her coming out of an underground pub...
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: That's where I came from. I happened to run into her when she went to have a drink with old friends.
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: Sounds like she really considers herself your friend.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Yeah... if only she considered herself more than a friend.
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: Eliseo... I've always felt that Londinium could become a better place, that Victoria would be proud of her.
attributes.name: Diane

attributes.content: Can the Speaker really make that happen, though?
attributes.name: Diane
